name: Merchant
description: You were apprenticed to a trader, caravan master, or shopkeeper, learning the fundamentals of commerce. You traveled broadly, and you earned a living by buying and selling the raw materials artisans need to practice their craft or finished works from such crafters. You might have transported goods from one place to another (by ship, wagon, or caravan) or bought them from traveling traders and sold them in your own shop.

ability_score_improvement.description: A background lists three of your character's ability scores. Increase one by 2 and another one by 1, or increase all three by 1. None of these increases can raise a score above 20.

improvement_options.description: Increase one ability score by 2 and another by 1
Increase all three ability scores by 1

benefits: Luck Points: You have a number of Luck Points equal to your proficiency bonus and can spend the points on the benefits below.  You regain all spent Luck Points when you finish a long rest.
Advantage: When you roll a d20 for a d20 check, you can spend 1 Luck Point to roll an additional d20 and use the higher result. You can use this benefit only once per turn.
Disadvantage: When you roll a d20 for a d20 check, you can spend 1 Luck Point to roll an additional d20 and use the lower result.
